meanings.definition: Confit: a method of preserving food by cooking it slowly in fat
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a delicious confit of duck for the special event.
meanings.sent2: The confit of garlic added a rich flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The confit of vegetables was so tasty that even the pickiest eater enjoyed it.
meanings.sent4: The confit of fruits in the dessert was a symphony of flavors.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the confit filled the kitchen, making everyone's mouth water.

meanings.definition: Confit: a dish made by cooking food slowly in fat, typically used for preserving meat
meanings.sent1: The restaurant served a savory confit of pork that melted in your mouth.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to make confit of chicken from her grandmother's recipe.
meanings.sent3: The confit of beef was so tender, it practically fell apart with each bite.
meanings.sent4: The confit of lamb was a culinary masterpiece that impressed all the guests.
meanings.sent5: The golden-brown color of the confit made it look irresistible on the plate.
